intro: Crepis lancifolia, commonly known as the lancolate hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairless stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow ray flowers surrounded by a series of tubular florets, which are typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in grassy habitats and along roadsides. Crepis lancifolia is generally hardy and can thrive in a variety of soil types, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
